intro: Zigadenus muscitoxicum, commonly known as the death camas, is a toxic plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It contains potent alkaloids that are highly toxic to humans and animals, making it a dangerous plant to handle or ingest. Due to its toxicity, it is often avoided in horticulture and requires careful identification to prevent accidental poisoning.
